de.mrapp.textmining.util.tokenizer

Class AbstractTokenizer<TokenType extends AbstractToken>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.textmining.util.tokenizer.AbstractTokenizer<TokenType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tokenizer<TokenType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FixedLengthTokenizer, NGramTokenizer, RegexTokenizer, SubstringTokenizer

    public abstract class AbstractTokenizer<TokenType extends AbstractToken>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tokenizer<TokenType>
    An abstract base class for all tokenizers.
    Since:
    1.2.0

    • Method Detail

      • addToken

        protected final void addToken(@NotNull
                              @NotNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TokenType> tokens,
                              @NotNull
                              @NotNull java.lang.String token,
                              int position,
                              @NotNull
                              @NotNull java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer,TokenType> tokenFactory)
        Adds a new token to a map, if it is not already contained. Otherwise, the token's position is added to the existing token.
        Parameters:
        tokens - The map, the token should be added to, as an instance of the type Map. The map may not be null
        token - The token, which should be added, as a String
        position - The position of the n-gram, which should be created, as an Integer value
        tokenFactory - A bi-function, which allows to create a new token, as an instance of the type BiFunction. The bi-function may not be null

      • onTokenize

        protected abstract void onTokenize(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.lang.String text,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TokenType> tokens)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to tokenize a specific text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text, which should be tokenized, as a String. The text may neither be null, nor empty
        tokens - A map, the tokens should be added to, as an instance of the type Map. The map may not be null

      • tokenize

        @NotNull
public final @NotNull java.util.Set<TokenType> tokenize(@NotNull
                                                                 @NotNull java.lang.String text)
        Description copied from interface: Tokenizer
        Splits a specific text into tokens.
        Specified by:
        tokenize in interface Tokenizer<TokenType extends AbstractToken>
        Parameters:
        text - The text, which should be split into tokens, as a String. The text may neither be null, nor empty
        Returns:
        A set, which contains the tokens, the given text has been split into, as an instance of the type Set. The set may neither be null, nor empty
